result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Nevel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall have no contact with any one under the age of 18 unless as authorized by the probation agent.  

Defendant shall have no possession or use of pornography and/or sexually explicit materials.  

Defendant shall not possess or use a computer or any technological device including a cell phone with internet capabilities without prior written permission from the probation agent.

Defendant shall have no contact with J.B.M. or his family.  

Defendant shall not enter any establishment where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  

Defendant shall comply with a sex offender treatment assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall comply with sex offender registration.  

Defendant shall provide random urinalyses.
Defendant shall undergo and complete an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.  
Per Court 11-23-2020 grant 351 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
All conditions of Extended Supervision are as contained in the Judgment of Conviction dated December 2, 2014 that were conditions of probation.

Court orders judgment for outstanding financial obligations.
